text:
Learning how to
say someone's name

correctly is a vital part
of honoring who they are

and making it known
that you care.

One of my worst days was after
a big competition was done.

They said my name so strangely
that I didn't know I had won.

When I realized only
a name like mine

could be messed up this
bad, I wanted to cry,

and it was very
hard not to be mad.

When it comes to unique names
in the professional world,

it is no hidden secret
that having a unique name

can hinder your job
prospects simply

because managers
tend to hire people

that remind them of
themselves and avoid
making them uncomfortable.

My unique name has hindered
my relationship-building

with people who are less
comfortable attempting

to say my name or say my name
incorrectly so often that I'm

certain they're not intent on
respecting me as a co-worker.

My goal at HBS has been
to find my unique voice

and focus on that so that
I can make the world just
a little bit better of a place.

The very first thing people
need to know about me
is how to pronounce my name.

If I can't get
past this step, it

will be difficult to
feel like I can truly
leave an impact in other areas.

I want people with
more common names

to understand the impact of
consistently mispronouncing

names of their peers,
their students, and even
their co-workers

My name is Shekeyla
Caldwell Sandore,

and I'm the author
of A Name Like Mine--

A Rhyming Story about
Diversity and Inclusion.

I hope that A Name
Like Mine will

build the confidence of uniquely
named children in addition

to teaching everyone about
the importance of learning
to pronounce names correctly.
